title: Asbestos is a bigger problem than we thought
description: The video explores how asbestos ended up everywhere and why it's still being used today. Sponsored by Ground News. Covers the asbestos boom, interviews with experts, and current exposure risks.
transcript: Asbestos. It's in our homes, our schools, our workplaces. And despite everything we know about its dangers, we're still mining it, still using it. How did we get here?

title: This Common Substance Was Once Worth Millions
description: The surprising story of a once-valuable material that shaped industries and economies. From peak demand to the forces that changed everything.
transcript: There's a substance so common today you probably have it in your pocket. But there was a time when it was worth more than gold.

title: We still don't understand magnetism
description: A deep dive into one of physics' most mysterious forces. Why do magnets work? What we know, what we don't, and why it matters.
transcript: Magnets. We use them every day. But ask a physicist how they actually work, and you might be surprised by the answer.

title: What Happens If You Keep Slowing Down?
description: Exploring the limits of velocity and what happens at the edge of physics. From everyday speeds to the nature of time itself.
transcript: What if you could slow down forever? Not just a little. All the way down. What would you find?

title: The World's Most Important Machine
description: The machine that changed everything. Why it matters more than you think, and how it shaped the modern world.
transcript: There's one machine that made almost everything else possible. And you probably use it every single day without thinking about it.

title: The Future of Veritasium
description: Derek's vision for the channel and what's coming next. Behind the scenes, new directions, and the future of science communication.
transcript: After over a decade of making videos, I wanted to share where Veritasium is headed and what excites me most about the future.

title: There Is Something Faster Than Light
description: Can anything travel faster than light? Exploring the limits of physics, causality, and what we think we know about the speed limit of the universe.
transcript: Nothing can go faster than light. Right? Well, it turns out the answer is more interesting than you might think.

title: The Man Who Accidentally Discovered Antimatter
description: The story of Carl Anderson and the accidental discovery that changed physics forever. Cosmic rays, cloud chambers, and the birth of particle physics.
transcript: In 1932, a young physicist saw something in his cloud chamber that shouldn't exist. That moment changed everything we know about matter.

title: You've (Likely) Been Playing The Game of Life Wrong
description: You might be playing Conway's Game of Life incorrectly. The real rules, the common mistakes, and why it matters for understanding emergence.
transcript: Conway's Game of Life. Simple rules, infinite complexity. But most people get at least one of the rules wrong. Including me, for years.

title: Why don't jet engines melt?
description: The engineering behind jet engines and why they don't melt at extreme temperatures. Materials, cooling, and the physics of flight.
transcript: Jet engines run at temperatures that would melt most metals. So how do they survive? The answer involves some remarkable engineering.
